meanings.definition: The act or process of accelerating.
meanings.sent1: The accelerations of the car were thrilling as it sped down the track.
meanings.sent2: The accelerations of the roller coaster made my stomach drop.
meanings.sent3: The accelerations of the snail were surprisingly fast for its size.
meanings.sent4: The accelerations of technology in recent years have been remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The accelerations of the cheetah are unmatched in the animal kingdom.

meanings.definition: An increase in speed or velocity.
meanings.sent1: The sudden accelerations of the train caught us off guard.
meanings.sent2: The accelerations of the rocket propelled it into space.
meanings.sent3: The accelerations of the turtle were comically slow compared to the hare.
meanings.sent4: The accelerations of the economy led to rapid growth.
meanings.sent5: The accelerations of the waterfall created a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The rate of change of velocity.
meanings.sent1: The accelerations of the car around the corner were smooth.
meanings.sent2: The accelerations of the athlete during the race were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The accelerations of the sloth were almost non-existent.
meanings.sent4: The accelerations of the river current were strong after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The accelerations of the pendulum were perfectly timed.
